gov.va.med.srcalc.web.view

Class EditVariable

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.va.med.srcalc.web.view.EditVariable

  • public final class EditVariable
extends java.lang.Object

    Encapsulates the operation to update an existing variable.

    Workflow:

    1. Construct an instance based on an existing variable.
    2. Present the user with the initial values and the "reference data" such as getAllGroups().
    3. Have the user update the properties as desired.
    4. Use EditVariableValidator to validate the user's edits.
    5. Call applyToVariable() to update the target variable with the new properties.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EditVariable

        public EditVariable(AbstractVariable variable,
            java.util.Collection<VariableGroup> allGroups)
        Constructs an instance.
        Parameters:
        variable - the target variable. Will be stored, but not modified until calling applyToVariable().
        allGroups - all available VariableGroups for user selection. Will make a defensive copy, preserving iteration order.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateDependentModels

        public void calculateDependentModels(java.util.Collection<RiskModel> allModels)
        Calculates and stores which, if any, of the given RiskModels depend on the target variable.
        Parameters:
        allModels - the models to check

      • getDependentModels

        public java.util.SortedSet<RiskModel> getDependentModels()

        If calculateDependentModels(Collection) has been called, returns the set of RiskModels that depend on this variable for the user's reference. Otherwise, returns an empty set.

        Returns:
        a set sorted by the RiskModels' natural order

      • getAllGroups

        public com.google.common.collect.ImmutableCollection<VariableGroup> getAllGroups()
        Returns the collection of all VariableGroups provided to the constructor. Iteration order is preserved.

      • getKey

        public java.lang.String getKey()
        The key that uniquely identifies the variable, suitable for displaying to an administrative user.

      • getDisplayName

        public java.lang.String getDisplayName()
        Returns the display name which applyToVariable() will set.

      • setDisplayName

        public void setDisplayName(java.lang.String displayName)
        Sets the display name which applyToVariable() will set.

      • getHelpText

        public java.lang.String getHelpText()
        Returns the help text which applyToVariable() will set. Since this property is intended to be used directly in JSPs, an absent value is represented by an empty string.

      • setHelpText

        public void setHelpText(java.lang.String helpText)
        Sets the help text which applyToVariable() will set.
        Parameters:
        helpText - may be null or empty, which will be translated to an absent value

      • getGroupId

        public int getGroupId()
        Returns the database ID of the variable's group.

      • setGroupId

        public void setGroupId(int groupId)
        Sets the database ID of the variable's group. Accepts an invalid group, though applyToVariable() will throw an exception if an invalid group is set.

      • getGroup

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<VariableGroup> getGroup()
        Returns the actual VariableGroup object corresponding to the set group ID.
        Returns:
        an Optional containing the group if it exists

      • applyToVariable

        public AbstractVariable applyToVariable()
        Sets all stored properties on the target variable.
        Returns:
        the stored target variable for convenience
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no group exists for the set group ID
